# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    wrapped_text = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 <= text_width
            if isempty(line)
                line = word
            else
                line *= " " * word
            end
        else
            wrapped_text *= isempty(wrapped_text) ? line : "\n" * line
            line = word
        end
    end
    
    # Add the last line if it exists
    wrapped_text *= isempty(wrapped_text) ? line : "\n" * line
    
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a sample text that will be wrapped correctly."
println(wrap_string(text, 10))
```

This function will split the input text into words and iteratively add them to a line until the line exceeds the specified `text_width` limit (default is 10). When the limit is reached, it starts a new line. The result is a string with words wrapped within the given width.
